website_summaries.verdict: The Motorola Moto G6 Play is a more affordable take on the standard G6 that trades some power for battery life, striking an ideal balance of price and performance.
pros: Support for all major US carriers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone for a low price.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent phone for a very good price. Massive memory and dual SIM. Very little pre installed stuff. Screen is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Moto G6
customer_reviews.text: My fourth Moto G & as you'd expect the best. Great features for the price range & very well made. Two reasons to hold back the fifth star, my phone has a intermittent tendancy not to ring. Seems to be a software issue on some Bluetooth ringtones. Secondly, the screen is good but clarity could be better. I'd definitely recommend the phone though.....must be best in class!
customer_reviews.author: Gary G

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Phone packed up a few days after using it, had to return for a refund. It wouldn’t pick up WiFi signal, lots of others complaining too I noticed.
customer_reviews.author: mrs me

customer_reviews.title: ... Iphone X and can say that this is far better value for money
customer_reviews.text: I've come from an Iphone X and can say that this is far better value for money, if this was priced slightly higher and had 4k, it would be a game changer. Nonetheless, one of the best phones I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Sid Russell

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, spend the extra and get the dual SIM version
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Sony Xperia z5 compact, so firstly in comparison this phone it massive. However I have adapted quickly. It does charge very quickly and I only need to charge maybe every 2 days. I was dubious about picture quality with it being only 17mp but I took a pic side by side with the Sony 23mp and it was much better quality. I'm pretty pleased with my purchase and I'm glad to be out of a 24 month £34 a month contract! SIM only is much cheaper!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pinkkitty

customer_reviews.title: Didn't connect to my WIFI, so returned it
customer_reviews.text: The product looked great and worked okay as far as I could see. The biggest problem was it didn't connect to my WIFI. I tried all the fixes I could find on the internet and nothing worked and because I use my WIFI a lot, I had to return it. Might be a great phone for someone else who doesn't care about WIFI, but not for me. :( The delivery itself was super quick so really pleased with that, the packaging was good as well and the return service was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent battery life
customer_reviews.text: What an excellent phone for the money!!!! I purchased the dual SIM version due to regular travel and added a 200GB SD. The phone works smoothly with no connectivity issues (4G, WiFi and BT). The battery life is amazing, 36 to 48 hrs between charges, with no power management, and fully charged within 1 hour using the supplied adapter. Great phone for the money.
customer_reviews.author: jet_set_jim

customer_reviews.title: Motorola must be the world's best kept smartphone secret.
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with this, my second ever android phone. Purchased as an upgrade to my 1st - a Moto g5S which I bought as a relatively low cost way to try android out. The g5S was surprisingly good but I'm massively impressed with the g6 from both a software and hardware perspective. Dual SIM means I'm virtually guaranteed voice coverage wherever I go but I must admit I've hardly used the second SIM and could get by without it. Picture quality and speed of processing much better than the g5 was. Battery life good. USB-C a great improvement. Can't believe what I'm getting for my money when I look at the cost of Samsung etc.
customer_reviews.author: J. Macrae

customer_reviews.title: Good phone although the sound leaves a lot to be desired.
customer_reviews.text: Had this phone for just shy of 2 months, everything was going great. The screen was sharp, it was snappy and fluid whilst being used. the only thing that lets it down is the audio, they have really cut corners with it. it wasn't great to begin with but after just shy opf 2 months use it became distorted and horrible, so it has now be returned and preplaced with a different phone. Such a shame as everything else was good especially at it's price point, but a phone with rubbish sound is no good nowadays.
customer_reviews.author: Weemacbantam

customer_reviews.title: NFC/Signal pick-up weak
customer_reviews.text: NFC barely worked. Even with phones back to back, it refused to do the initial migration from my old phone, which was a G5 Plus. Took it to the pub it refused to work again. Then once more. Was testing the signal strength outdoors; swapping the sims over from the G5 Plus to the G6 and back again. The G5 Plus was getting 4G where the G6 would only get H+ or 3G. It may look nice on the outside. The camera may be ok, but it's the old adage, you get what you pay for. Under the bonnet, the build quality just ain't there.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Dual SIM is very handy to have.
customer_reviews.text: Quite a good phone, photo quality is semi-decent but I absolutely hate manufacturers that sell products whilst the softwsre is buggy. The software in question is the Moto app which provides features such as the use of gestures to activate the camera app, turn the phone over to silence incoming calls and sounds. It just does not work! Even after you have given the app all the permissions to access your SMS messages, access to your photos, access to your storage and retrieval everything else which the software really does not need (a spying app perhaps ?) the software will work on one occasion but then not again. It's a complete joke Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: TheEngineer

customer_reviews.title: Superb budget smartphone.
customer_reviews.text: Punches above its weight for a budget phone. I like some of the extra features such as the motion activated torch. The included software never bothered me, I ignored Outlook and I don't recall anything else being a nuisance. The camera, which I recall another reviewer saying is slow, is now super quick. I presume it was fixed with a software update. Photos are good quality. I'm hoping the snappy processor and 4GB RAM will give me a few years use before the inevitable slowdown from bloatware. Battery life has been very good, especially using wifi. Overall I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: PLASMA wombat

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade to previous versions of the Moto G phone
customer_reviews.text: Great upgrade to previous versions of the Moto G phone. Great to have the compass and USB C. A fast phone with a very good display. I preordered it and have used it for a few weeks and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Colin S Le Conte

customer_reviews.title: Great value Phone
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of older people (I am 73) I'm not too concerned with most of the high end features that phone manufacturers seem to compete with each other on. I am intereseted in making/receiving calls, sendin/receiving texts, taking occasional photos/videos. On al of these functions this phone exceeds my expectations given the price compared to the more expensive Iphones, samsungs etc. I had previously used an IPhone 6S and apart from getting to grips with the Android system this phone compares more than favouably with the 6S. Highy recommend as a money saving alternative to the expensive phones for ordinary everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: JFIreland

customer_reviews.title: Great phone at this price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my G6 for a few months now. At this price it's a cracking phone, a spec that would be top notch not all that long ago. 8 cores and 64 GB storage should last me a while! Sure, it ain't no Google Pixel but at a shade over two hundred quid something's got to give. The screen and camera are both very good, and it runs apps very well with very little lag. Minor gripe, it could do with a bit less uninstallable crapware (Outlook, I'm looking at you) but for the most part it's fairly close to stock Android.
customer_reviews.author: Limiting Factor

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, fantastic price
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of those who really admires my friends' flashy iPhones but then can't bring myself to fork out a grand for a phone. With the Moto G6 I have an excellent phone and a nice smug feeling that I've 'saved' £800. It does everything I want it to and I keep finding helpful little upgrades and tricks that make it worth having relegated my perfectly functional G3. Key points are the super-quick turbo charger - 0-100% in a couple of hours (and it lasts), the dual rear camera for really clear pics with portrait setting for flattering selfies and the sharp graphics. Winner. Thanks Moto.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B. J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent smart phone at a decent price
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with this purchase. The larger screen size means it's much more useful and practical than my previous smartphone. Although I prefer to take photographs on a bespoke camera, for "snaps" the camera on this phone is more than adequate. I had a Moto before this but this moto means that I've got much more space for the increased number of apps I want to use. For my needs, this phone is excellent - I'd highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: CeeBee

customer_reviews.title: The video recordings have bad sound distortion
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality of the video recordings on my Motorola G6 is very poor. It is a known issue for Motorola and there is a long thread about it on their forum. Recorded voices of people are distorted and impossible to decipher. There's a squeaky sound on and off. If I can't sort it out the phone's ruined for me
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: My son was surprised and very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Purchesed on amazon day for my son, He wanted a huawei so wasn't too happy, however when he realized it was made by lenovo and opened it up and gave it a try he was pleasantly surprised at how good it was. Battery life is awesome, the camera is great and it records videos in 4k. Sound quality is awesome, gameplay apparently a bit slow, but that's what his PC is for.
customer_reviews.author: Supermum

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Switched from a moto g4 (which had died) to the g6 and so far I am very pleased with the new phone. Very easy to set up and get going (other than about 5 software upgrades which had to be installed separately. Not difficult but a little frustrating). Like that it has Outlook available from set up so I can abandon Gmail. Can't rate facial recognition as I haven't set that up but fingerprint works well. I have single sim version and it does have NFC in the settings
customer_reviews.author: mythicalkings

customer_reviews.title: Very good value and nice and fast
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Moto phone I've had, the last one just got too slow after a couple of years. The new phone is much faster with more internal memory and much faster processor than the older model. The last model was a G4 Play, if you can afford it get the G6 rather than the G6 play. You're able to add your own SIM to expand the memory and even have a second SIM so you can have more than 1 carrier.
customer_reviews.author: M P Ruse

customer_reviews.title: Major audio bug
customer_reviews.text: Phone worked great for a couple of months. However now having serious audio issues. Advice would be to steer clear of this until Motorola fixed this issue. Upon googling this appears to be a common issue with the phone. Audio stops working and no apparent fix for it
customer_reviews.author: Lambo

customer_reviews.title: 3 out of 3 returned. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these in July 18, one for myself and two more for my daughters. All 3 have now developed faults. Mine decided to simply stop working and then some 45 minutes later started again. This happed multiple times. Both of my daughters phones literally came unstuck during the hot weather. NB..Whilst they were indoors! Amazon have refunded me for all three as I am a Prime customer. I wonder if I was simply unlucky or if they were from a dodgy batch.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Poor signal and buttons fell off!!
customer_reviews.text: Signal issues and the on and off button and volume buttons dropped off the phone after having the handset for a year!! Really angry and disappointed. First time I've had a moto phone and it was a huge disappointment. Signal is not good on this phone. I get no signal inside my work building which my previous iphone and Samsung did and the other day the keys just dropped off the phone! it wasnt dropped or anything, I called moto and they said they would fix the phone for free until they learnt it had a scratch on the screen and said the warranty is no longer valid! FURIOUS. avoid MOTO!
customer_reviews.author: JAS

customer_reviews.title: Pound for Pound. You won't get better!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second G6 Amazon exclusive I have purchased. I was so impressed with it, I bought my wife one as well. This is as good as any flagship premium phone, but without the ridiculous price tag. These phones do exactly what they are meant to do, and they do it very well!! My wife is a heavy user and uses all the social media apps, she also uses it for her job. The phone has yet to cause her an issue!!!
customer_reviews.author: David J Greville

customer_reviews.title: Bought for work: Dual Sim
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty good and the Dual Sim feature is a must if you travel a lot for work. Even in the UK, network coverage by some providers is pretty poor so it's currently installed with an EE sim (main) and a cheap GiffGaff pay monthly as a secondary (they're on the O2 network). So far I've not come across anywhere that one of them doesn't work. Just a pity they're not Dual Active (but I don't think there are many of those around these days).
customer_reviews.author: AllanL

customer_reviews.title: Truly excellent phone for the price Moto g6 64gb
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product as a replacement for iPhone 5s which was getting on a bit. One week in and I love it. With an extra storage card I no longer have to go through my photos and back them up weekly and delete conversations on WhatsApp. Front speakers are nice and clear, screen is big and bright. Finger sensor functions all work perfectly. Battery better than the old iPhone though it does re charge alot quicker too. I have even stuck my work Sim in there to allow me to have everything in the one place.
customer_reviews.author: John Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from Moto g3
customer_reviews.text: I've been impressed with every aspect of this phone! After previously having a Moto G3 I thought I'd upgrade and I have no regrets. After 6 months the battery is still lasting nearly two days with fair usage. The screen and glass back are both holding up well. The phone still feels fast. And I have no memory issues. The usb-c helps to future proof the phone and it also has a gyro which the G3 didn't, allowing vr games. Overall I could not recommend this phone more and I'd buy it again if I could go back.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Horrible noise on video playback
customer_reviews.text: Such a shame - this is an otherwise excellent phone for the price but the video playback is awful. I tested a few times and every time on playback there is a horrible noise like static or a radio station not tuned in properly. Tried in different conditions and even used the Open Camera app but the same result. Save your money and by something different....unless you're not planning to record video of course
customer_reviews.author: Colin John Grant

customer_reviews.title: Great phone!
customer_reviews.text: So far I am satisfied with it (2 months of use), the camera works very well also the system, all the apps as well, great memory, very good battery life. The only fault is it does not take the high temperatures well! The camera was freezing in a 38 degrees temperature in Thailand! Whereas my husband's Nokia 7 worked without faults in the same temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slippery as a soap bar!
customer_reviews.text: Well I had a G5 for two years and was very happy with it...so I went ahead and bought the G6. Very nice phone, elegant and works well but there is a big problem, the phone is so slippery! I dropped it about 5 times in the first 3 days and cracked the glass, so I sent a letter to Motorola (stupidly I thought they might change the glass) explaining that I had had the phone for only 72 hours and the glass was broken. Bog standard reply, not under warranty, bla bla bla. So be warned great phone but buy a protector!
customer_reviews.author: barrybaker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic phone for such a reasonable price. Of course, you aren't getting the top of the range specs but at the end of the day this has a fingerprint reader which works well, NFC and quick charge which is handy and good picture quality along with good enough speeds. If you are a heavy gamer then this won't be the most ideal phone for you, but then you can't expect that for this price. I mainly use mine for browsing, texting, phoning and the odd game here and there and have no issues with the battery life or quality of the phone itself.
customer_reviews.author: Welsh Customer

customer_reviews.title: Black screen and unresponsive
customer_reviews.text: I have bought each generation of Motorola’s G series, this is the first that has died before a year despite being careful and not dropping or damaging it. It now turns off and will not turn back on without pressing the volume down + power. The sound is good but doesn’t go low enough, I have use the app precise volume to decrease media volume at night so audio books are quiet enough to help me drift off to sleep without disturbing anyone. NFC and the finger print scanner are great for convenience. Screen quality is also good. Maybe mine is just faulty but I have bought two and the other one had the same issue last week.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Usual superb Motorola quality
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with ratio of spec to price Finger print reader is very reliable and quick to react Camera isn't outstanding but does give great photos Huge amount of storage with 64gb. Have still used an SDcard for music but phone itself has plenty of space for apps etc Bloatware is kept to a bare minimum Dual SIM works great Battery lasts through the day with ease majority of time Great phone with superb value Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Ollossk

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from Moto g5 and I've not seen any major differences yet.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this phone as an upgrade for my Moto g5 which only had 2GB of RAM and 16GB of storage. I imagined this phone would be a huge upgrade but I have been left slightly disappointed. Although it definitely is an upgrade, it's not as fast nor powerful as I envisioned. It struggles to run apps such as Snapchat and Instagram (closes apps) at times, I'm hoping that's all it will struggle with during my time with it. I wouldn't pay any more than the price it was listed at when I had bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Sparks

customer_reviews.title: EXCEPTIONAL VALUE MOTOROLA G6
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a Samsung Galaxy S8 from BT for £500.00 I recently bought a Motorola G6 from Amazon for £200.00 In my opinion the Motorola is just as good as the Samsung, in fact it has three advantages - a bigger screen, it is dual sim version, and best of all you save a massive £300.00. I rest my case.
customer_reviews.author: N P Liddicoat

customer_reviews.title: Motorola make the best budget mid-range phones.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a backup for my ageing Moto G4, this is the last of the Moto G phones to have a fingerprint reader on the front and not have a notched display. Yuck! I loathe the notch. Till Motorola bring out a G series with no notch and with under-screen fingerprint reader (they are so sexy), I am sticking with the G6 versions for as long as possible. Also, 64GB storage for £200. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Steven F

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 'budget' smartphone
customer_reviews.text: This is a excellent 'budget' smart phone which has so many high end features and some which are better than phones 3x to 4x what its cost. I have had this for 6 months and no issues at all. The phone also comes with a protective sleeve so another saving to be made. Highly recommended if you can look beyond the apple and Samsung badge and are on a budget
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Cracking phone for the money
customer_reviews.text: Had the phone for a month. Really impressed, good camera and very easy to navigate. Battery life hasn't been an issue but the fingerprint reader can be a bit hit and miss. Getting a bigger sd card as I think I'll be using it more for the "smart features" compared to my old Xperia. If you're not a slave to labels, having to be seen holding one of the supposed "big hitters" and feel nauseous at the mere idea of spending £700+ for a communication device, this could be the phone for you.
customer_reviews.author: Mr A J Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Second Moto G replacing a Moto G4 Plus. So far battery has been far better than the previous one I had the G4 where battery performance was always an issue....with normal use the G6 lasts a day. Screen is good, camera can have a slit delay sometimes but photos are good. For the price and performance I'd recommend and would buy another. Stripped down version of Android is an advantage as well (from a personal perspective)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cracking mobile phone for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mobile phone. A great device. Its responsive and quick and there are not too many ridiculous intrusive apps bundled in. The screen is bright and clear, and it charges very quickly with the included super charger. I like the camera and also I think the portrait mode is pretty impressive for the price of the mobile phone. For what you get specification wise this really is a very good phone. I've come from a Samsung and I now prefer this as a brand and would certainly buy another one within the Moto range!
customer_reviews.author: C. Horswill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This must be the best value phone on the market, it has great battery life, 64gb memory, 4gb ram and all the features that I need for under £250. It's my second Motorola/Lenovo phone and my wife also loves her G4. I highly recommend this to anyone who wants a great, functional phone without the marketing bs and the stupidly high price tag.
customer_reviews.author: John wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Screen keeps going blank
customer_reviews.text: The screen went black during a call and could not turn it back on. Had to press the OFF switch for 15 seconds to get the phone to work again. Did this twice in one day. Frustrating. Otherwise a LOVEL phone. This is the third phone I received. First one people couldn't hear me well, it was like odd noises during calls - they said the motherboard had not been glued on properly. The second one would just switch off on its own. Now, this... disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Adelina

customer_reviews.title: Silver Dream Machine
customer_reviews.text: Big fan of this phone. Purchased for my partner for Christmas and it's very, very handsome. Amazing screen for the price with plenty of storage unlike previous incarnations of the series. It's fast as well and handles plenty of tasks without struggling. Decent camera for the price,....so no complaints.... girlfriend loves the silver finish
customer_reviews.author: martin

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: There is no need to buy an expensive phone when you have something like this. The phone is really good and it is well worth the money, even though it doesn't even cost that much compared to "high end" phones which don't even offer anything much better than this. Overall, the phone is really good and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I made the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I actually love my phone I only have a few things that's very disappointing it's to do with the phone storage when I take pictures I have trouble shifting them to the memory card also the speakers are not as loud as I would have like them to be when I put them on speakerphone other than that the phone is very good I normally have Samsung this is my first Motorola and I am happy with my purchase just a shame that the speakers are not as loud as I anticipated or wanted and also the problem with the memory phone It's a lovely lightweight phone beautiful colour and I would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Rita W.

customer_reviews.title: Great phone heaped with plenty of security features
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mobile phone and I can see why it was a best buy recommendation in some magazines. I didn't like the facial recognition option as it smacks too much of big brother. The fingerprint reader falls into a similar category. That said, you do need some security on your device. Uses the Android operating system and is a handy size. Would buy it again if available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice phone until this morning when the speaker stopped working seven days after the warranty ran out! battery usage is very poor lasting less than a day & I am not a high user by any means. I will definitely not be buying any more Motorola phones. The last Moto was so expensive to replace the screen that I didn't bother & bought this one instead. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Pickford

customer_reviews.title: Top budget phone, well recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I researched carefully and extensively for "the best budget smart phone" and settled on the G6. I've had it a few months now and am very pleased and satisfied with my choice. The slightly irritating delay with the camera action mentioned elsewhere hasn't proved to be too much of an issue once one gets used to it. Apart from that it's a brilliant phone and v good value.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Good call
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from my old G3, that had given great service but was getting past it. The G6 has had great reviews and fulfilled my expectations. A good choice for the best of the budget phones with many aspects better than the price suggests.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Android Phone
customer_reviews.text: This is a superb Android phone, particularly when discounted to£180. Dual SIM, finger print reader, decent storage, decent screen, no slow down, good software build. It is just about perfect for typical mobile usage.
customer_reviews.author: Domino

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PHONE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great phone i used to have the moto g3 then i went to Samsung (that didn't last me long) then i bought a Sony (that started to malfunction after a year) and guess what the moto g3 is still going strong after all these years so i decided i was going back to Motorola and thought id buy the latest g6 model and what a great phone it is for the price i paid (£200) so easy to use and has all the latest features (USB type-c charging port, fast charging, finger print scanner) I'm happy I've gone back to Motorola I've learnt from my mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: neil stevenson

customer_reviews.title: A winner!
customer_reviews.text: Very good so far! Motorola rocks, as always. I'm not huge on gaming, but for the basics (apps included), this phone is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Dujon

customer_reviews.title: Appalling rubbish. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: A complete waste of money. It may be a dual-SIM phone, but it supports 4G in only one of the SIM slots. It may be a dual-SIM phone, but you can fully control the ring on only one of the SIMs. When it was (automatically, and with no roll-back option) updated to Android Pie it became a tool of torment - apparently a now common problem of epic proportion that is being completely ignored by the manufacturer (Forum thread: "Re: Moto G6 - Lag / Irresponsive - Post Pie Update [G6 Users pls share your reviews here]" - 56 pages, and growing, of ignored complaints.). The latest OS update hasn't fixed anything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't make calls!!!
customer_reviews.text: The non-phone features of this phone are excellent. Unfortunately, even after a factory reset, and having subsequently found via Google that the model suffers from a recurring in-call sound issue, decided to return it within 48 hours. If callers cannot hear your voice, then it matters not how good is the phone!
customer_reviews.author: Ian Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Phone going back as it has failed .
customer_reviews.text: I am finding that the quality of the Amazon goods has deteriorated of late. I have had to return a few goods and I am now going to be returning this phone as it has ceased to work for me. It will not even switch on. Prior to this it would start misbehaving and I would have a blue screen for a while and have to switch the phone off and then on. I am so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: The Quine

customer_reviews.title: I love this phone
customer_reviews.text: Great phone....does everything that I want and was very easy to set up...Lenovo has recently repaired my old g4, free of charge. Even though it was out of warranty... The g6 is a good phone by a good company.... The g6 is slightly smaller than the g4....if you have big hands, you may want to look at the g6Plus.... A happy buyer
customer_reviews.author: David Guy Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, poor camera.
customer_reviews.text: A great phone at £195. It runs all apps well as far as we've used it. If you're dropping down from a flagship phone you will notice the much poorer screen, the colours are washed out. The camera is probably the phones achilles heel, its very poor. Unless you've got great light and the objects are still you'll be deleting photos much more often than saving then. But overall you won't find a better phone for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Great phone. Punches far above its weight
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. Punches far above its weight. The default choice for a “budget” phone. Camera is good, at times very good. But picture quality is not as good as the high end Samsung and IPhone models. But you’d expect a trade off at this price. This is my 5th Motorola G series phone.
customer_reviews.author: N. Nunes

customer_reviews.title: Lasted until warranty was up
customer_reviews.text: Great phone for the first year - lots of features for half the price of other brands. Sound wasn't great as others have commented. But just after the one year warranty was up, it packed in completely. It shut down and I got a 'start up failed' message. It instructed me to use the Software Repair Assistant to repair it. However, the Lonovo Software Repair Assistant wouldn't even recognise that the phone was plugged in to the pc. I brought it to 2 repair shops who said it was unfixable. I had photos back up but lost all other data. So recommendation is 'do not buy'.
customer_reviews.author: J O'B

customer_reviews.title: I really like this phone
customer_reviews.text: It's a good, value-for-money smartphone. That's all there is to say really. It handled the upgrade to Android Pie the other day without problems. It's not as fast as the Samsung Galaxy S8 I use for work, but it's good enough. The cameras are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Platypus

customer_reviews.title: Great phone at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great phone for a great price. Easy to use, easy to set up. Great battery life to. Rapid charge. All the features of a top line phone, for a fraction of the cost. Build quality is great to. Dual sim and expandable memory. Is perfect for me too get my 2 phones into 1. Great. Just what I wanted for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: TST Enterprise Ltd

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money.
customer_reviews.text: Brought a few Motorolas over the last 10 years and they're great. Always really well priced. Nice looking. Great external and internal storage. Screen quality is amazing. Not 100% on the camera but it's definitely not bad when considering the price. Highly recommend these products as a cheap android alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Brett J Devey

customer_reviews.title: Leading the way
customer_reviews.text: This android phone is new to ma as I have had a windows phone previously so I needed to learn the android system. The Motorola G6 provided everything I needed to get me on line in a very short time. I have not been disappointed by the phone in any aspect at all and in terms of value and reliability (to date) it must be one of the best on the market I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Noz

customer_reviews.title: Good value smart phone, but call audio can be better
customer_reviews.text: Runs latest version of Andriod, fingerprint reader is good, all apps work well. The only downside is audio quality - hard to hear unless phone is positioned just right, also the people on the receiving end say it is hard to hear as audio is very low compared to calling from a different phone, so maybe microphone pickup is not that great. But when putting phone on speaker phone audio quality is fine (for both me & receiver of call).
customer_reviews.author: Stuffer In Cheif

customer_reviews.title: A good quality smartphone at a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: The phone is a very solid performer with a good screen, quick response times and a decent camera. If money is no object and your phone is very important to you, I am sure that there are better phones, but in terms of value for money it is difficult to beat and it is competent in all areas.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Android 9 does not run smoothly
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was fairly pleased with this phone. The camera however is pretty poor and very laggy. However the update to Android 9 was pushed out 2 months ago and now the screen is blank for about 7 seconds after unlocking and seems slower in general launching apps. Pretty pathetic.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my brother and he says it is the best phone he has ever had! He loves watching videos as the screen is large and sharp and the sound is excellent. It is speedy for surfing the internet and photos are sharp and clear. Have deducted a star because the battery life could be better but most phones need to be charged quite often.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for movies
customer_reviews.text: Decent phone. For large media files, the phone is pretty useless in playing back such files (> 3 gb files). So if you are looking for a multi media phone for videos and movies, this is not it. Definitely not it. However, for everything else, short videos, streaming and gaming, its more than capable with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Senh

customer_reviews.title: Best value budget phones?
customer_reviews.text: Love the moto series, not sure there is a better range of budge smart phone. This phone may struggle with low light photos but can it make phone calls - yes. All the apps- yes. Latest version of Google OS- yes. If you want to take top class photos spend £800 on a camera and not an iPhone/Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: TommyDeVito

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Had a G3 & G4 in the past. This phone is pretty good. Can't see that it does less than more fashionable or premium brand phones costing two or three times the price. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: big norman

customer_reviews.title: Phone was great, until it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This phone was a really good smart phone for the price, until after owning for 3 months it powered off and stopped working out of the blue. I sent it back to Motorola to be fixed under warranty to be told that the phone had "liquid damage" (despite coming into contact with no liquid and being advertised as water repellent) so couldn't be fixed under warranty. Motorola wanted to charge me £119 for the repair plus £20 to send it back - almost as much as the phone cost in the first place. My husband has the same phone and has had no problems, so maybe I got unlucky. I won't trust Motorola/Lenovo's warranty after this though.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Jenks

customer_reviews.title: So good, so cheap
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone. Had Moto g since the first gen. This is a great quality version Get the Amazon version as it is more phone for a little more money.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Good phone
customer_reviews.text: I wanted and AR Capable phone and it delivered. And loved using it. But sadly returned it as I got this for my Bday for myself but someone gave me more expensive phone as gift too.
customer_reviews.author: Ritish

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Always used an iPhone until I started getting problems and then bad customer service from my provider I decided to go Android and SIM only , this phone had good reports and the dual SIM , now I'm paying allot less a month and using two network providers and have a reliable phone , that's all we really want from one really isn't it ?
customer_reviews.author: david martin

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: The item supplied has a power socket of who known's what type , even the cable that came with it does not fit it so you simple cannot charge the phone . You really have to ask why it was even sent in that condition in the first place knowing it would be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant phone. Masses of memory. All my apps only use 20% so far. Occasional screen failure to recognise touch, but only in Firefox, so probably the app's fault. Sometimes the auto-brightness gets it too dim in low light situations. Do wish there was a printed start/setup guide. Having to consult help pages and relying on Android/Google AI, you're not sure of the implications of all your choices. Overall, incredible value for money. It even upgrades to Android 9 Pie when you start it.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Mark

customer_reviews.title: Worst phone I've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this phone, it looks good, its easy to use BUT it drives me to absolute distraction. It constantly freezes, reboots or randomly turns off. I have lost many photos and contacts because of this. I really can't stand it anymore I am buying another phone and it won't be Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: marandina2

customer_reviews.title: It was difficult to open the draw to insert the sim card.  I had to use a paperclip instead.
customer_reviews.text: I sent the first phone back because I couldn't open the sim draw only finding out that a paperclip would open it when I got the replacement phone. The replacement arrived superfast before the original would have arrived back-thanks Amazon. The phone is easy to use and I had no trouble transferring the data from my old phone even though I'm not very tech savvy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Android V9 crashes the phone all the time don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy android V9 crashes the phone and Motorola want me to back up all my stuff reset to factory losing all my apps even ones I paid for I am not debugging thier software V9 for them
customer_reviews.author: adele o'sullivan

customer_reviews.title: 64 gb 12 meg rear camera decent screen for a budget Mobile.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my wife needed a phone so gave her my g4 as she doesn't need as much memory as me it has 64 gb storage and apps seem to run fast enough for me only downside is you seem not to be able to screen shot with this model where as you could with the g4 I had overall wouldn't say itis much different to my g4 except being 64 gb.
customer_reviews.author: mr colin wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday phone
customer_reviews.text: Had the Moto G 6 for a couple of months now. Massive improvement over the G4. Extra memory and storage makes a huge difference. Brought for £199 in a sale paired with a SIM only deal just makes sense.
customer_reviews.author: Mr carl downs

customer_reviews.title: Great phone at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge fan of Moto G phones and have had a few of them from the first one they released. With each one being a decent upgrade from the last. I'm not massively in to tech, and as someone that uses a phone as a phone, along with simple things like checking emails the odd photo etc then this phone us perfect Works well, was cheap, large amount of memory, got an update to android pie out of the box You won't go far wrong getting this if you want a decent phone on a budget from a decent brand.
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great phone at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for the the camera, was one of the better deals at the price point. Good pick and cant go wrong
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Problem staying connected to Bluetooth earpiece.
customer_reviews.text: On the whole good phone but no good using Bluetooth when driving which is dangerous. You having to switch the Bluetooth off and then on to connect to the phone even when you are connected to it. It's vital for my job. Will have to go back to my other phone now. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Chop

customer_reviews.title: Best Android phone for under £190
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a GREAT Android smartphone for under £190, then Moto G6 (Single SIM, 32 GB) is the best available option in the year 2018. There are two issues with this: microphone quality (which can be intermittent) and information on when Motorola will release Android software update. Other than these two, I have no other issues with this phone after using this for just over 2 weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: Can't make calls
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my husband. However he can't not do normal phone calls with it. The other side often couldn't hear him or hear him probably. We don't have other issues with this phone.
customer_reviews.author: JADE

customer_reviews.title: Battery gone within a year
customer_reviews.text: Within a year battery problem has started, didn't get earphones, customer service is worst..they wanted to repair it but I wanted to get a replacement so still stuck with same phone.never in my life wil buy a phone online..but my experience wit Indian Amazon was really good, but not co.uk
customer_reviews.author: Sw

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone has everything you get with a high price Apple, Samsung or Google phone but costs more than £500 less. Also seems very robust which is important to me. No brainer!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE it
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for over three months. Best phone I've ever had for this price. Wow. I'm truly in love! Loooads of memory, good quality pictures (could do with a bit more quality on the front camera, but it has FRONT FLASH[!!!] so i'll forgive it), the battery lasts the whole day using it a lot and, with the TurboCharger it gets back to 100% extra quick. A must have for all of us who can't/don't want to spend hundreds on a phone! :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why spend a grand when value phones are this good
customer_reviews.text: Great phone, amazed friend with iPhone 7, really who needs to spend a grand. Nice to get booked memory through Amazon special. Upgrade to pie stupidly slow but still a good phone
customer_reviews.author: Real Amazon Customer no shill

customer_reviews.title: So much better than a phone at this price has any right to be!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the phone for around a month now. It's snappy and has so far handled everything I've thrown at it pretty easily. I love the Moto gestures (the karate chop for the flashlight should be on every phone) and using the fingerprint scanner as navigation is awesome. The only slight niggle I have with the phone so far is the battery life is pretty average. With phones at this price point becoming this good I really can't understand the need to spend £800+ on a flagship phone.
customer_reviews.author: Mr S J Eveleigh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for people aiming for £300 or less
customer_reviews.text: Best phone I've had. I never spend more than £300 on a phone, so I'm not sure how this compares to a higher end phone, but for music, photos and general social media I've never had a better phone. The Dolby audio features are fantastic, really make the music come alive. The Moto features are mostly useful and bloatware is fairly low. Honestly, it's a pretty good phone
customer_reviews.author: james cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Specs of a phone twice the price!
customer_reviews.text: I'm now using the phone for 1.5 months, and I can't remember a single complain. It performs better and faster than my previous LG G6 (which is hundreds of pounds more expensive). Believe the positive reviews (I agree with them). Camera is nothing special, though portrait photos look nice. Btw, flashlight feature is really cool and handy. Overall, I think there isn't any phone that can beat this one in value.
customer_reviews.author: Matija

customer_reviews.title: Quick recharge.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great phone that lasts more than 24 hours on a charge and recharges in little over an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Len Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Really impressed
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always been an avid user of apple products. I bought this as a replacement for my daughters iPhone. I’m so glad I did. It’s jus as fast, has a larg screen and everything she needs for a much lower price compared to apple. Don’t think I will go back to apple and I will be buying myself one when my phone finally kicks the bucket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This phone randomly shuts down and reboots
customer_reviews.text: This phone is absolute rubbish. We are in to our 4th month of using this phone and from the second or third week of use it shuts down and reboots randomly and constantly. The phone is so unreliable. I would advice strongly against buying this phone a total waste of money. STAY CLEAR.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little phone
customer_reviews.text: Great little phone for those that don't want a 6 incher in their hands. Battery life goes into next day and speed and quality have no issues. Altogether a very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: marcusl

customer_reviews.title: Photo on website is misleading
customer_reviews.text: My Motorola moto g6 64GB Smartphone arrived and I was very disappointed to see that it did not come with a cover which the picture on the website led me to believe would be included. I now realise that is simply a rear view of the device. Guess things can only get better from here on.
customer_reviews.author: Solomon

customer_reviews.title: All good so far
customer_reviews.text: All good so far. Main problem is that it's a bit big, but you can't seem to get phones with decent features that are a sensible size any more.
customer_reviews.author: pcq
